title: Ucrânia e Rússia realizam maior troca de prisioneiros da guerra até agora
cleaned_sentences: Advertising Ukraine and Russia have begun the biggest change of prisoners since the beginning of the conflict, with almost 800 prisoners being returned by both parties.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky confirmed that 390 Ukrainians were returned to Russia and that the exchange process will continue in the coming days.
“It's very important to bring everyone back home,” wrote Zelensky in his Telegram account, thanking everyone involved in the efforts to ensure the return of prisoners.
Continues after advertising The images of the arrival of the Ukrainian prisoners, released by Zelensky's office, showed former head prisoners being received by their families.
Meanwhile, Russian prisoners were taken to Belarus for medical treatment, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense.
Although the exchange was significant, it does not seem to indicate an imminent pause in the fighting.
The prisoner exchange agreement is part of the “1,000 per 1,000” plan, which was discussed during peace conversations in Istanbul the week before.
Continues after advertising The first phase of the exchange took place on the Belarus border, where Ukrainian authorities prepared to receive released prisoners.
The Russian Ministry of Defense stated that the first phase of the exchange resulted in the return of 270 military personnel and 120 civilians.

Despite the exchange of prisoners, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov ruled out the possibility of future peace negotiations in places like the Vatican, claiming that this would not be appropriate.

Continues after advertising Lavrov also questioned Zelensky's legitimacy, suggesting that new elections would be the most appropriate way to determine who should represent Ukraine in future negotiations.
